caption: Oprah Winfrey wore a GPS ankle monitor during her interview with Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex.

result.explanation: The image shows Oprah Winfrey interviewing Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex.  There is no visual evidence to support the claim that Oprah Winfrey wore a GPS ankle monitor.

candidates.title: No, Oprah Wasn't Wearing an Ankle Monitor During the Harry and Meghan Interview
candidates.content:
Claim:
Oprah Winfrey wore a GPS ankle monitor during her interview with Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex.
Origin
Followers of the QAnon conspiracy cult frequently claim to see GPS-monitoring ankle bracelets on high-profile political figures and celebrities, and Oprah Winfrey is no exception. During Winfrey's bombshell interview with Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, on March 7, 2021, some took to social media to report they believed they saw evidence that Winfrey was wearing one. Here's an example of one such post, with the user's name cropped out for privacy:
As we have previously reported, QAnon followers generally believe that various Democratic legislators and A-list celebrities are part of a satanic, cannibalistic pedophile ring:
In general, QAnon believes [former U.S. President Donald] Trump is in the middle of a biblical war against a deep state, satanic cabal of baby-eating, child sex-traffickers led by prominent members of the Democratic party, entertainers who espouse liberal opinions, anybody who mentions pizza, and authoritative sources who relay credible information that may cast a negative light on the president. Proponents of this theory believe that one day soon the storm will come and Trump, with the help of an anonymous high-ranking military official known as Q, will round up members of the deep state, arrest them, and possibly have them executed.
The latter part of the above paragraph explains why QAnon followers believe so many famous people wear ankle monitors. The belief system prompts them to look for signs that those famous people are on the brink of mass arrest, as they wait, and wait, for the so-called "storm" of arrests and prosecutions to come.
But Winfrey wasn't wearing an ankle monitor, nor is she being GPS-tracked by a fictional "Q" character and a former president. She was wearing long, brown leather boots, and the bump that people saw was simply a crease in the material when she sat with her legs crossed.
candidates.description: Oprah Winfrey's brown leather boots drew some people's attention for the wrong reasons.

result.explanation: The provided text from Snopes explicitly debunks the claim that Oprah Winfrey wore a GPS ankle monitor during her interview with Prince Harry and Meghan.  The article states that the appearance of an ankle monitor was a misinterpretation of a crease in her boots. The Snopes article directly addresses and refutes the claim made in the news caption.
result.supporting_points:
Claim: Oprah Winfrey wore a GPS ankle monitor during her interview with Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex.
But Winfrey wasn't wearing an ankle monitor, nor is she being GPS-tracked by a fictional "Q" character and a former president. She was wearing long, brown leather boots, and the bump that people saw was simply a crease in the material when she sat with her legs crossed.

final_result.explanation:
The original caption claims that Oprah Winfrey wore a GPS ankle monitor during her interview with Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex.  This claim is demonstrably false based on both internal and external validation.

Internal Validation:
The provided image shows Oprah Winfrey in a casual setting, conducting an interview with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. There is no visible ankle monitor on Oprah. A careful examination of the image reveals no device resembling a GPS tracking device. This visual evidence directly contradicts the caption's assertion.

External Validation:
The external check utilized Snopes, a reputable fact-checking website. Snopes explicitly debunks the claim, stating that the perceived ankle monitor was a misinterpretation of a crease in Oprah's boots. This external evidence strongly supports the conclusion that the caption is inaccurate.  Snopes provides a detailed explanation and photographic analysis that clarifies the misunderstanding. The high confidence score of 10 reflects the definitive nature of the Snopes debunking.

Discrepancies:
There are no discrepancies between the internal and external validation. Both independently confirm the falsity of the original caption.  Both analyses are consistent, and corroborate each other, leading to a high level of confidence in the final assessment.

Confidence Score:
A confidence score of 10 is assigned because both the internal (visual inspection) and external (fact-checking website) validations concur and decisively refute the claim. There is no ambiguity or conflicting evidence.

Conclusion:
Based on the strong agreement between internal and external checks, the original caption is demonstrably out of context. The claim is factually incorrect and lacks any supporting evidence within the image or from reliable external sources. The overwhelming evidence points to a misinterpretation of a natural crease in Oprah Winfrey's boot as a GPS ankle monitor.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal (visual analysis) and external (Snopes fact-check) validations strongly refute the caption's claim.  There is no conflicting evidence, resulting in a high confidence score.
